HERE IS THE FIX FOR INFINITE LOADING AND SAVE GLITCH

Works on Windows 7 and multi core CPU and yet I experienced these if you check task manager > performance and you see only had one CPU there. So something weird was going on. 

open start > run > msconfig and went to boot > advanced options and deselect the checkbox for 'number of processors'.
 Then reboot. Now I have 4 CPU's in my task manager.
Just tested the game and now it works fine, even with autosave on, music enabled and Directx 11.

OK, fixed the voices and dialogs. Copy the "vo" folder from "Modules" folder to "\packages\core\audio\vo". Overwrite the resident "vo" folder with the copied "vo" folder. You can move the folder, too.

To all who have problems with installing-do this(Windows 7):

Press SETUP and with this, one thing with music will pop up.  
 Start Task Manager with CTRL-ALT-DELETE and remove that thing. After this installation is available(you need to press any button on that instalation).

HEY!!!
I dwnloaded dlc packs 4 this game and it says dragon age 2 needs to b installed first.
I guess the installation didn't add to reg.
But when i ran the reg file given it says the same thing. Is der ny way 2 install dlc.???
same goes 4 patch.... :(

GOT IT!!!
for any1 having same prob as mine...
Run regedit
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Bioware\Dragon Age 2
double click on path
If value is %d, change it to your real directory
eg. C:\Program Files\Dragon Age 2
or wherever you installed.
Now go to where you installed and right click on DragonAge2Launcher.exe and run as admin.
Quit back to desktop and all DLC's should be working fine....
CHEERS!!!

for anyone having trouble with audio / facial animation;

go:
Modules\Audio\Vo\En-us: then copy all files from Facialanimations and Vo folders

Copy into Packages\Core\Audio\Vo\En-us\VO

 Et Voila
